intro: Maesa kivuensis, commonly known as the Kivu maesa, is a shrub native to the forests of the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant features simple, elliptical leaves with a smooth upper surface and a hairy underside. Its flowers are small, white or pale pink, and are clustered in dense inflorescences. Maesa kivuensis is often found in moist, shaded environments and plays a role in local ecosystems.
